Side Project



Learning and Teaching Mandarin in Scotland, November 2022 - December 2023



This project is led by Professor Antonella Sorace and funded by Confucius Institute for Scotland’s Schools (CISS) and Scotland’s National Centre for Languages (SCILT). Along with the other two research assistants, I engaged in designing questions for questionnaires and interviews, contacting schools, conducting interviews with pupils and teachers, performing quantitative and qualitative analysis as well as preparing a report.

title: Yajun Liu
text: Hi, I am a final-year (4th) PhD student in Linguistics at the School of Philosophy, Psychology and Language Sciences (PPLS), the University of Edinburgh. I am supervised by Professor Kenny Smith and Professor Antonella Sorace. I am also a member of the Centre for Language Evolution. My research project focuses on the phenomenon of referential over-explicitness in the native language of late bilinguals undergoing first language attrition, specifically among speakers of L1 Chinese with L2 English and L1 Chinese with L2/L3 Italian or Spanish. I explore the underlying mechanisms of this phenomenon from both linguistic and cognitive perspectives. More broadly, I am interested in the role of communication in shaping languages over time within bilingual communities.
